subject: Re: [junit] a test pattern ?
msgSnippet: On Tuesday 26 April 2005 17:40, in a message called Re: [junit] a test ... Hee-hee, I can t resist... Don t you mean SmtpUnit or SMTPUnit? -- Jason Rogers I
messageBody:
On Tuesday 26 April 2005 17:40, in a message called Re: [junit] a test
pattern ?, Adam Wildavsky wrote:
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger wrote:
> >Adam Wildavsky wrote:
> >  > There are a number of books that contain testing patterns. Ross
> >  > Rainsberger's "JUnit Recipes" was just recommended.
> >
> >"Ross Rainsberger"?! Wow. Where the hell did you get /that/ first name?
> >
> >:) (I'm sure there's a neat story behind that.)
> >
> >It's J. B. Rainsberger, thanks.
>
> My apologies. It's not much of a story, I'm afraid. I know a "Ross
> Rainwater" and my fingers did the rest. It serves me right for typing
> when I ought to have been copying and pasting.
>
> Where was SmptUnit when I needed it?

Hee-hee, I can't resist... Don't you mean SmtpUnit or SMTPUnit?

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
